Sentencas: Direct Carbon Fuel Cells (DCFC) offer efficient conversion of coal or biomass derived carbons to electricity.
Titulo: Studies of current collection configurations and sealing for tubular hybrid-DCFC

Sentencas: A Hybrid Direct Carbon Fuel Cell (HDCFC) is a type of DCFCs that combines solid oxide cell geometry with a molten carbonate fuel cell electrode.
Titulo: Studies of current collection configurations and sealing for tubular hybrid-DCFC

Sentencas: This study focused on investigating different current collection configurations and sealant for tubular HDCFC concept.
Titulo: Studies of current collection configurations and sealing for tubular hybrid-DCFC

Sentencas: A HDCFC used a gadolinia doped ceria (GDC) or a YSZ as the electrolyte, in composites with NiO and LSM as the anode and the cathode, respectively.
Titulo: Studies of current collection configurations and sealing for tubular hybrid-DCFC

Sentencas: Three different current collection configurations of HDCFC were investigated by AC impedance in order to study the electrochemical phenomena that occur at the electrodes surface.
Titulo: Studies of current collection configurations and sealing for tubular hybrid-DCFC

Sentencas: The AC impedance results showed that both the surface area and the position of the current collector inside of the anode chamber affect drastically both the series resistance (R-s) and the polarisation resistance (R-P) values.
Titulo: Studies of current collection configurations and sealing for tubular hybrid-DCFC

Sentencas: The lowest total resistance (R-tot) was achieved on Configuration b with silver wire interwoven nickel mesh attached to the side of the anode wall by silver paste (R-tot = 2.98 Omega) and while the highest R-tot was achieved on the configuration c with silver wire interwoven nickel mesh inserted into the mixture of carbon and carbonate (R-tot = 149 Omega).
Titulo: Studies of current collection configurations and sealing for tubular hybrid-DCFC

Sentencas: The leak test carried out on several sealants demonstrated that composite sealants of Toku P-24 paste and an alumina silicate disc produced a low degree of leaks due to both the high resistance to the carbonate mixture and high density sealing after curing compared to the ceramabond.
Titulo: Studies of current collection configurations and sealing for tubular hybrid-DCFC
